intro: Barleria inaequalis, commonly known as the variable barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its showy, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in late spring to early summer. Barleria inaequalis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
